summary: This document is a set of 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in continuous lockdown status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, requiring observation at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the standard operating procedure for inmate monitoring at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

keyFacts: The document is a prison log detailing 30-minute inmate checks in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York on August 10, 2019.
It outlines the procedure requiring staff to observe inmates in continuous lockdown (e.g., administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The log is formatted with time frames for Morning Watch, Day Watch, and Evening Watch, each overseen by a Lieutenant.
Each check sheet is for a specific tier (ZA Tier-G, H, J, K, L, M) within the SHU.
The sheets were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of oversight for inmate monitoring.
